{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Intellinet |model=450N |revision=rev.A (524988) |upc=777786337896 |ean= |asin=B004XT6UUS;US;,B0092VRHOK;US; |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=10/20/2011 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Edimax |manuf_model=BR-6675nD |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router |fcc_id=NDD9566751028 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.25 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Ralink |cpu1_model=RT3883 |cpu1_cspeed=500 |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29LV640EBTI-70G |fla1_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Winbond |ram1_model=W9751G6JB-25 |ram1_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=RT3883 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Ralink |wi2_chip1_model=RT3092 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Realtek |sw_model=RTL8367R-VB |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware=Padavan ? |802dot11_protocols=abgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.2.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=1234 |oui= |oui_eth= }} {{TagLine|Wireless 450N Dual-Band Gigabit Router}} [http://www.intellinet-network.com/wireless-450n-dual-band-gigabit-router Product page]
[http://assets.mhint.s3.amazonaws.com/downloads/7035/524988_02_manual_eng.pdf User's Manual] ===Additional specifications=== *CPU: Ralink RT3883 :@500MHz [[MIPS 74K]] *Memory :Flash: 8MB :RAM: 64MB DDR2 *Wireless 5GHz 3T3R :Chipset: Ralink RT3883 *Wireless 2.4GHz 2T2R :Chipset: Ralink RT3092 *Antenna: 3x fixed-dipole with 3dBi gain each :5GHz: 3T3R MIMO mode (450Mbps) :2.4GHz: 2T2R MIMO mode (300Mbps) *Dimensions: [[Dimensions::127 mm x 195 mm x 35 mm|195 mm (W) x 127 mm (L) x 35 mm (H)]] *Weight: [[Weight::1.0 kg]] This device is presumed to be an [[Edimax BR-6675nD]]. The [[Hawking HD45R]] (re-branded + re-shelled 6675nD) is
using RTL8367R-VB, so this device is currently assumed to.. :However, the original Realtek RTL8367R revision :may be used with at least some of these units. The FCC photos seem to show the device with an A-cut RTL8367R. __NOTOC__
